p: The fatty acid profiles of pupae are reported in Table 3. Both strains had the highest amounts of saturated fatty acids (SFA), consisting mostly of palmitic (16:0) and stearic acids (C18:0) and monounsaturated fatty acids (MUFA), represented by palmitoleic (C16:1) and oleic acid (C18:1), when fed an artificial diet. Oleic acid was the most representative fatty acid in silkworm pupae, reaching the highest percentage in the Nistari strain fed with an artificial diet.
